definitions.definition: present (a complaint, appeal, claim, etc.) formally to the proper authorities.
examples: he has 28 days in which to lodge an appeal

definitions.definition: leave money or a valuable item in (a place) or with (someone) for safekeeping.
make or become firmly fixed or embedded in a particular place.
examples: they had to remove a bullet lodged near his spine
synonyms: wedge "the bullet lodged in his back"

definitions.definition: stay or sleep in another person's house, paying money for one's accommodations.
examples: the man who lodged in the room next door
synonyms: sojourn; archaicabide "William lodged at our house"

definitions.definition: provide (someone) with a place to sleep or stay in return for payment.
examples: accommodate, put up, take in, house, board, billet, quarter, shelter they were lodged at an inn

definitions.definition: (of wind or rain) flatten (a standing crop).
examples: rain that soaks standing or lodged crops

definitions.definition: (of a crop) be flattened by wind or rain.
